titleStmt.title: James M. Shepard to James F. Robinson
CWG8660

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p:
Georgetown Feby 16th 1863
His excellency Jas F. Robinson
Govenor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

There is a movement in progress for the purpose of asking of you as Govenor of the Commonwealth, the pardon of Philips for stealing of Benj. Osbornes horse, that he may be restored to his family and society; I am informed that he has served the Commonwealth most faithfully and I have been requested to write to you and ask an extension of Executive clemency in his case

Most respectfully yrs
Jas M. Shepard Counsel for Philips
